page.topic: Alpha Five Printer is not Installed
page.description: If the Amyuni printer is not installed, you cannot create Reports. This can be caused if the Amyuni installer failed or if the Amyuni printer was removed after installation.

section.description: The Amyuni printer is distributed as part of the Alpha Anywhere Application Server for IIS. It is used to generate Reports. If the Amyuni printer fails to install or is uninstalled, you cannot create Reports using Alpha Anywhere. If the Amyuni printer is not installed, it may manifest as an error when you try to create a Report:

figure.title: Error message sent from the Report server if the Amyuni printer driver is missing

link.alt: Report did not print. Error reported was: 'Alpha Five Printer' (for creating PDF, RTF and HTMl output) is not installed. Re-install Alpha Anywhere Appication Server for IIS at line: 31

description.p: The Alpha Anywhere Application Server for IIS installer will notify you that an error occured and details on where to find the installAmyuniPrints.log file.
If the Alpha Anywhere Application Server for IIS installer is not running in silent mode, the IIS installer will display this message as a popup dialog:

figure.title: Error installing Amyuni printer driver while installing Alpha Anywhere Application Server for IIS

link.alt: Error Configuring Alpha Anywhere Application Server for IIS. An unexpected error occurred while installing AmyUni printer driver.

description.p: If the installer for Alpha Anywhere Application Server for IIS is run in silent mode, the error will be logged to the Windows Event log instead.

section.note: For versions of the Alpha Anywhere Application Server for IIS older than build 3627, you will not be notified if the Amyuni installation failed. To determine whether or not the Amyuni install failed, you will need to check the installAmyuniPrinters.log file for errors. You can find the *[installAmyuniPrinters.log]* inside the *[Amyuni5]* folder in the installation directory. For example, *[bold:C:\Program Files (x86)\A5V12 Application Server for IIS\Amyuni5]*.

section.description: If an error occured during the installation of the Amyuni priner, it will be listed in the installAmyuniPrinters.log file:

If an unsigned printer driver was installed prior to installing the Amyuni Printer driver, the Amyuni installer will fail with an "Error Code: 87 Invalid Parameter" error. As *[extlink:Amyuni explains on their website@https://www.amyuni.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=18&t=2824]*:

"During installation the Microsoft certified printer driver, the Windows operating system copies and renames the amyuni.inf file and related printer driver files to the %system32%\DriverStore\FileRepository folder. Under some situations, Windows fails to copy the .inf file because of previous installations, mainly if the previous installation was for an unsigned printer driver. When installing a new version of the printer driver, the error 87 Invalid Parameters appears."

Before attempting to reinstall the Amyuni printer, the DriverStore\FileRepository folder needs to be cleaned up. For more information about this error and how to resolve it, follow the instructions detailed on Amyuni's website, *[extlink:Invalid Parameters installing PDF Converter printer driver@https://www.amyuni.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=18&t=2824]*.

description.p: In order to be able to create Reports, you need to install the Amyuni printer drivers. This is done by running the Alpha Anyhwere Application Server for IIS installer.

Locate the *[A5IISInstallServer.exe]* file. It can be found in the installation directory for Alpha Anywhere Application Server for IIS. Open command prompt with the "Run as Administartor" option and run the installer:

section.example:
C:\Program Files (x86)\A5V12 Application Server for IIS>A5IISInstallServer.exe
C:\Program Files (x86)\A5V12 Application Server for IIS>
